top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
Did we steal the veteran’s kids? How about the 911 victims? Did they get to keep their kids?

It sounds like a lot of money, but what's the price for tearing children away from their parents and sending them off to some unknown fate?

This was an act in the vein of Nazi Germany. It definitely wasn't nearly as severe, but traumatizing nonetheless, and puts one in mind of fascist practices.
They have nothing to do with eachother. What the fuck? Lmao

The US government literally kidnapped their children. The Fox "News" argument is that since they were exercising their **legal** right to apply for asylum, we are allowed to basically torture them with impunity.

In a just society the officials that did this would be getting hauled in front of a tribunal. Instead, they have plush gigs on Fox where they can continue pushing their evil, *evil,* toxic bullshit.

Did we steal the veteran’s kids? How about the 911 victims? Did they get to keep their kids?

It sounds like a lot of money, but what's the price for tearing children away from their parents and sending them off to some unknown fate?

This was an act in the vein of Nazi Germany. It definitely wasn't nearly as severe, but traumatizing nonetheless, and puts one in mind of fascist practices.

So we should pay the 9/11 family victims more?

Sure. Republicans will support that right?
